Package com.amplifyframework.auth

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    AuthCategoryBehavior
    Specifies the behavior for the Auth category.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AuthCategory
    Defines the Client API consumed by the application.
    AuthCategoryConfiguration
    Configuration for Auth category that also contains configuration for individual plugins.
    AuthCodeDeliveryDetails
    Wrapper class for representing the various aspects of a confirmation code sent to a user.
    AuthDevice
    Stores device information such as name and ID.
    AuthPlugin<E>
    Abstract class that a plugin implementation of the Auth Category would extend.
    AuthProvider
    A factory for some preset third party auth providers and the ability to create a new, custom one.
    AuthSession
    Stores the current auth state of the category.
    AuthUser
    Represents a logged in user with its locally cached attributes.
    AuthUserAttribute
    Holds the key and value for a user attribute.
    AuthUserAttributeKey
    Factory for preset user attributes and the ability to specify a custom one.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    AuthChannelEventName
    An enumeration of the names of events relating the AuthCategory, that are published via HubCategory.publish(HubChannel, HubEvent) on the HubChannel.AUTH channel.
    AuthCodeDeliveryDetails.DeliveryMedium
    The various ways a code could have been sent.
    AuthException.GuestAccess
    Allows the user to specify whether guest access is enabled or not since this can affect which recovery message should be included.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    AuthException
    Exception thrown by Storage category plugins.
    AuthException.AliasExistsException
    Could not perform the action because alias (an account with certain email or phone) already exists in the system.
    AuthException.CodeDeliveryFailureException
    Could not perform the action because error occured when delivering the confirmation code.
    AuthException.CodeExpiredException
    Could not perform the action because confirmation code has expired.
    AuthException.CodeMismatchException
    Could not perform the action because user entered incorrect confirmation code.
    AuthException.FailedAttemptsLimitExceededException
    Could not perform the action because user made too many failed attempts for a given action.
    AuthException.InvalidAccountTypeException
    Could not perform the action because the configuration of the signed in account does not support it.
    AuthException.InvalidParameterException
    Could not perform the action because there are incorrect parameters.
    AuthException.InvalidPasswordException
    Could not perform the action because the password given is invalid.
    AuthException.LimitExceededException
    Could not perform the action because number of allowed operation has exceeded.
    AuthException.PasswordResetRequiredException
    Could not perform the action because password needs to be reset.
    AuthException.ResourceNotFoundException
    Could not perform the action because Amplify cannot find the requested resource.
    AuthException.SessionExpiredException
    Unable to get valid credentials until the user signs in again.
    AuthException.SessionUnavailableOfflineException
    Could not get valid credentials due to the device being offline.
    AuthException.SessionUnavailableServiceException
    Could not get valid credentials due to an error from the underlying service.
    AuthException.SignedOutException
    Auth exception caused by the user being signed out.
    AuthException.UnknownException
    Could not perform the Auth operation for an unknown reason.
    AuthException.UsernameExistsException
    Could not perform the action because username already exists in the system.
    AuthException.UserNotConfirmedException
    Could not perform the action because user is not confirmed in the system.
    AuthException.UserNotFoundException
    Could not perform the action because user was not found in the system.
